Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: Choose the correct statement.
options: In traditional XHTML close tag for some elements is optional but not encouraged
In traditional HTML close tag for some elements is optional but not encouraged
In both traditional XHTML and HTML close tag for some elements is not optional
In both traditional XHTML and HTML close tag for some elements is optional
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: In XHTML all elements must always be closed and empty elements also be closed. XHTML close tags are not optional neither they are encouraged. HTML is case insensitive and thus closing tags for some elements including empty elements is optional and is ignored by browsers.

Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: Which of the following XHTML doctype declaration contains all HTML elements and attributes, including presentational and deprecated elements (like font) but not framesets?
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: The !DOCTYPE declaration is not an HTML tag; it is an instruction to the web browser about what version of HTML the page is written in. The XHTML doctype declaration “!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC “-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN” “http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd”” is of XHTML 1.0 strict, “!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC “-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN” “http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd”” is of XHTML 1.0 transitional, “!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC “-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Frameset//EN” “http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-frameset.dtd”” is of XHTML 1.0 frameset and “<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC “-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN” “http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd”>” is of XHTML 1.1.

Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: Which of the following is not a difference between HTML and XHTML?
options: Charset in html is “text/html” where as in xhtml it is “application/xml+xhtml”
Charset in both html and xhtml is “text/html”
Tags and attributes are case-insensitive in HTML but not in XHTML
Special characters must be escaped using character entities in XHTML unlike HTML
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: HTML is case insensitive while XHTML is case sensitive. In XHTML, special characters can be escaped using character entites but not in HTML. Charset in HTML is “text/html” where as it is “application/xml+xhtml” for XHTML.

Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: What indicates the content in file is HTML when delivered on the network.
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: Content-type: header indicates the content in the file is HTML and we can see file content through it when delivered on the network. “.html” is the file extension for HTML.

Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: HTML and XHTML stands for ______
options: Hyper Text Markup Language and Extensible HyperText Markup Language
Hyper Text Markup Language and Extensible HyperText Marking Language
Hyper Text Marking Language and EXtensible HyperText Marking Language
Hyper Text Marking Language and Extensible HyperText Markup Language
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: HTML stands for “Hyper Text Markup Language” and XHTML stand for “Extensible HyperText Markup Language”.

Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: Choose the correct tag for the largest heading in HTML.
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: Headings in HTML starts from <h1> to <h6> in which <h1> heading is the largest one and <h6> is smallest one among those. The heading tags are <h1> <h2> <h3> <h4> <h5> and <h6> that are used for the creations of headings.

Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: Which of the following are table tags?
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: Table has different tags such as table, thead, tr, td, etc whereas colospan is an attribute of table.

Traditional HTML and XHTML.question: Choose the correct HTML for width attribute and its value.
Traditional HTML and XHTML.explanation: Always mention the attribute value in quotes in HTML. It is one of the rule of HTML attributes.

Rules of (X)HTML.question: Which of the following is not a correct (X)HTML rule?
options: Unknown attributes are not ignored by the browser
Rules of (X)HTML.explanation:
Rules of XHTML are as- 1) XHTML elements must be properly nested
2) XHTML elements must always be closed
3) XHTML elements must be in lowercase
4) XHTML documents must have one root element
5) Attribute names must be in lower case
6) Attribute values must be quoted
7) Attribute minimization is forbidden

Web Browsers.question: A Rendering engine is not responsible for ________
options: parsing style information (CSS, XSL, and so on)
generating a visual presentation of the formatted content including media files referenced
Web Browsers.explanation: A rendering engine is a software that draws text and images on the screen. The engine draws structured text from a document (HTML, XML) and formats it properly based on the given style declarations (CSS, XSL, etc). The primary job of a browser engine is to transform HTML documents and other resources of a web page into an interactive visual representation on a user’s device.

Web Browsers.question: Firefox uses _________ rendering engine.
Web Browsers.explanation: Gecko is a web browser engine used in many applications developed by Mozilla Foundation and the Mozilla Corporation as well as in many other open source software projects. Gecko is free and open-source software subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License version 2.

Web Browsers.question: What is the use of “defer” attribute?
options: It defers rendering of html page
It defers script execution until the page has been rendered
It defers rendering of css attributes
It is only for internal scripts
Web Browsers.explanation: The defer attribute is a boolean attribute. The script is executed after the page has finished parsing. The defer attribute is used if and only if there is src attribute. Defer is for external not internal scripts.

Web Browsers.question: Which of the following statements is false?
options: async and defer attributes of script tag execute before the DOMContentLoaded event
async executes each script when it is ready
all older browsers supports async attribute
Web Browsers.explanation: In async attribute, the script is executed asynchronously with the rest of the page (the script will be executed while the page continues the parsing). Defer, the Boolean attribute is set to indicate to a browser that the script is meant to be executed after the document has been parsed, but before firing DOMContentLoaded event. Older browsers doesn’t support async attribute.

Web Browsers.question: Which of the following is used to read a HTML page and render it?
Web Browsers.explanation: A web browser (commonly referred to as a browser) is a software application for retrieving, presenting and traversing information resources on the World Wide Web. A web server process, store and display output to client as per their request. Web matrix is a discontinued cloud-connected website builder and HTML editor for Windows.

Web Browsers.question: Which of the following is the first web browser?
Web Browsers.explanation: The first web browser was invented in 1990 called World Wide Web which was later renamed to Nexus. In 1995, a graphical web browser named Internet Explorer was developed. The Netscape is a web browser produced by Netscape Communications. NCSA Mosaic, or Mosaic, is the web browser which in turn popularized World Wide Web.

Web Browsers.question: Who created the first web browser
Web Browsers.explanation: Sir Timothy John “Tim” Berners-Lee, also known as TimBL, is an English computer scientist, best known as the inventor of the World Wide Web. He made a proposal for an information management system in March 1989, and he implemented the first successful communication between a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) client and server via the Internet sometime around mid-November of that same year.

Web Browsers.question: The open source software version of netscape is _________
Web Browsers.explanation: On February 23, 1998, Netscape Communications Corporation created a project called Mozilla to co-ordinate the development of the Mozilla Application Suite, the open source version of Netscape’s internet software, Netscape Communicator.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: Which of the following is not an IDE?
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: Dreamweaver is an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) tool. Aptana Studio 3 is an open-source integrated development environment (IDE) used for web applications. BlueGriffon 1.5.2 is an integrated development environment powered by Gecko. TextEdit is a simple, open-source word processor.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: IDE stands for _________
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: An integrated development environment (IDE) or interactive development environment is a software application that provides comprehensive facilities to computer programmers for software development. An IDE normally consists of a source code editor, build automation tools and a debugger.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: We can define ________ number of sites with one copy of dreamweaver installed on our computer.
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: Dreamweaver is an IDE to build custom web apps and applications. There is no definite liit to it.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: What should we add to a template in Dreamweaver in order to control where page content goes?
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: A template is a special type of document that you use to design a “fixed” page layout; you can then create documents based on the template that inherit its page layout. Editable template regions control which areas of a template-based page a user can edit. Frames appear inside a web page.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: Blue Griffon is based on ________ rendering engine.
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: BlueGriffon is a new WYSIWYG content editor for the World Wide Web. Powered by Gecko, the rendering engine of Firefox, it’s a modern and robust solution to edit Web pages in conformance to the latest Web Standards. WebKit is a browser engine used in safari. Presto is a dynamic engine.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: Swapping images in dreamweaver is best if __________
options: The images are the same “Mime” type
The images are the same color
The images are the same size
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: Before you start creating a more complex page design with Dreamweaver’s Swap Image behavior, look at a finished page. Swapping means replacing any or all images on the page. While swapping images, it is important to make all images of same size (height and width). MIME stands for “Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: Choose the inappropriate option with respect to Blue Griffon 1.5.2. Blue Griffon _________
options: includes tools for developing HTML5 pages
supports direct embedding of audio and video files
supports swapping of videos of any length
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: Blue Griffon 1.5.2 is a new WYSIWYG content editor for the World Wide Web. Blue Griffon 1.5.2 includes tools for developing HTML5 pages. It can abstracts out many CSS3 effects, supports direct embedding of audio and video files. Blue Griffon 1.5.2 does not support swapping of videos of any length.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: Choose the correct statement.
options: Exo is a cloud-based ide that offers collaboration and developed features
Exo does not support java and python
Exo does not support javascript and html5
Exo is a cloud-based ide that offers collaboration and deployment features & its supports javascript and html5
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: Exo provides a free, cloud-based IDE that offers collaboration and deployment features. In addition to HTML5 and JavaScript, it supports the development of Java, Ruby, and Python applications.

Choosing Editors and IDEs.question: Which of following statement is true?
Choosing Editors and IDEs.explanation: Cloud9 IDE is an online integrated development environment, published as open source from version 2.0, until version 3.0. It Supports for the following code repositories: 1) GitHub, 2) BitBucket, 3) Mercurial repositories, 4) Git repositories, 5) FTP servers. Cloud9 support deployment to 1) Heroku 2) Joyent 3)SFTP/FTP.

Choosing Web Servers.question: Which of the following is not a web server?
Choosing Web Servers.explanation: Tornado is a web server written in python language. Eclipse is a web server (Java HTTP server). Apache Tomcat, is a web server which is also known as Tomcat server. BlueGriffon is an IDE.

Choosing Web Servers.question: Which of the following interface is not supported by LightTPD?
Choosing Web Servers.explanation: Interfaces like FastCGI, SCGI and CGI are supported by LightTPD to external programs to be used with the server.

Choosing Web Servers.question: Which of the following is not a prepackaged server stack?
Choosing Web Servers.explanation: Collection of software that forms operational infrastructure is a server stack. WampServer refers to a software stack.XAMPP is prepackaged stack developed by Apache Friends. To run dynamic web sites on computers, a solution stack known as MAMP is used. There is nothing like NAMP.

Choosing Web Servers.question: Which of the following is not a channel of mozilla?
Choosing Web Servers.explanation: Mozilla Foundation & Corporation developed a open source web browser named Mozilla Firefox. Later on, new version of mozilla arrived in market, which are named as Firefox Beta & Firefox Aurora respectively. Firefox alpha is not a channel of mozilla.

Choosing Web Servers.question: Which of the following are automatically loaded and operates as a part of browser?
Choosing Web Servers.explanation: Functionality of firefox can be extended as well as modified by using Add-ons. Plugin programs operates as a part of browser. A utility provides an addition to the capabilities provided by the operating system. A widget is a simple application extension that is already installed on the device.

Choosing Web Servers.question: Which of the following allows user to view a webpage?
Choosing Web Servers.explanation: An interpreter is a computer program that directly executes, instructions written in a programming or scripting language. A website is a collection of related web pages, which contains multimedia content. An operating system is a balancing bridge between hardware and software. A web/internet browser allows user to view a webpage

Choosing Web Servers.question: What is DOM?
options: Convention for representing and interacting with objects in html documents
Choosing Web Servers.explanation: The Document Object Model is a cross-platform and language-independent application programming interface that treats an HTML, XHTML, or XML document as a tree structure. A document can be viewed as a logical tree with help of DOM Model.

Compatibility Libraries.question: Which one of the following is an open source JavaScript library that enables styling for HTML5 elements in versions of Internet Explorer before IE 9 ?
Compatibility Libraries.explanation: HTML5 Shiv is a JavaScript workaround, invented by Sjoerd Visscher, to enable styling of HTML5 elements in versions of Internet Explorer prior to version 9, which do not allow unknown elements to be styled without JavaScript. HTML 5 defines the properties and behaviors of web page content. It is a web language.

Compatibility Libraries.question: Which one of the following is not a step to install a library you need to perform the compatibility in browsers?
options: Download the library from the github location
Insert the following code inside the head tag

Compatibility Libraries.question: Which property is used to detect the browser’s user agent and code based on the pertinent cases?
Compatibility Libraries.explanation: An old strategy was to look at the property navigator.userAgent to detect the browser’s user agent and code based on the pertinent cases.

Compatibility Libraries.question: Some users have requested tests for IE’s float double margin bug, and support for position:fixed. Which API is suitable for them?
Compatibility Libraries.explanation: The navigator object contains information about the browser. UseAgent property gives user-agent header sent by browser to the server. A navigator.userAgent is used to detect the browser’s user agent and code based on the pertinent cases.

Compatibility Libraries.question: ___________ is an open source JavaScript library that allows support for different levels of experiences based on the capabilities of each browser.
Compatibility Libraries.explanation: Modernizr is an open source JavaScript library that allows support for different levels of experiences based on the capabilities of each browser using a simple feature detection model. Geolocation is the identification of geographic location of an object. The navigator object contains information about the browser. Google API, i.e set of application programming interface which allow communication with Google Services & integration to other services.

Compatibility Libraries.question: ____________ allows you to add custom styles to the document and test an element afterwards.
Compatibility Libraries.explanation: Modernizr.testStyles() allows you to add custom styles to the document and test an element afterwards. An element with the id of “modernizr” is injected into the page.

Compatibility Libraries.question: ___________ is used to test whether geolocation is supported in old browsers.
Compatibility Libraries.explanation: Since Modernizr is a JavaScript object with methods, we can use Modernizr.geolocation to test whether geolocation is supported. Geolocation API Detects support for the Geolocation API for users to provide their location to web applications.

Compatibility Libraries.question: ____________ is a resource loader (CSS and JavaScript) that was made to specifically to work side-by-side with Modernizr.
Compatibility Libraries.explanation: Modernizr.load is optional in your build, but if you are loading polyfills, there’s a good chance it can save you some bandwidth and boost performance a bit. Modernizr.load objects print out on your page in the exact spot they should be, coming after the Modernizr.

HTML Metadata.question: In which part of the HTML metadata is contained?
HTML Metadata.explanation: Metadata is information about data. The meta tag provides metadata/meta information about the HTML document. Metadata will not be displayed on the page. Metadata is present in head. The body tag defines document’s body. A title tag is an HTML element which specifies the title of a web page.

HTML Metadata.question: Which of the following is not a function of robots meta tag?
HTML Metadata.explanation: Valid values for the “CONTENT” attribute are: “INDEX”, “NOINDEX”, “FOLLOW”, “NOFOLLOW”, “NOARCHIVE”. “NOREPEAT” is not any of robots meta tag.

HTML Metadata.question: What is the role of charset attribute? It specifies
options: a scheme to be used to interpret the value of the content attribute
the character encoding for the HTML document
the character decoding for the HTML document
HTML Metadata.explanation: A charset attribute is new in HTML5. The charset is used to provide the character support. The charset attribute specifies the character encoding which is in an external script file.

HTML Metadata.question: __________ prevents the page from being indexed altogether.
HTML Metadata.explanation: NOFOLLOW attribute instruct search engines that a hyperlink should not influence the link target’s ranking in search engine. NOINDEX prevents page from being indexed. To prevent a page from being cracked, NOARCHIEVE tag can be used. The noindex value of an HTML robots meta tag requests that automated Internet bots avoid indexing a web page.

HTML Metadata.question: Which of the following is not supported in HTML5?
HTML Metadata.explanation: The scheme attribute is supported in HTML but not in HTML5. Rest of attributes like “content”, “http-equiv” and “name” are supported in both HTML as well as HTML5. The scheme element is deprecated from HTML5.

HTML Metadata.question: ___________ prevents search engines from following links inside the page.
HTML Metadata.explanation: NOFOLLOW attribute instruct search engines that a hyperlink should not influence the link target’s ranking in search engine. NOINDEX prevents page from being indexed. To prevent a page from being cracked, NOARCHIEVE tag can be used.

HTML Metadata.question: Different meta tags are defined by changing the __________ attribute to a valid value.
HTML Metadata.explanation: The information/value of the content is provided by http-equiv through http header. Some values associated with http-equiv and name attribute are given by the content attribute. A scheme that to be used to interpret the value of the content is specified by the scheme tag. The name attribute specifies the name of input element and thus provides information/value of it.

HTML Metadata.question: __________ prevents search engines from showing a cached link for the page.
HTML Metadata.explanation: The “noarchive” meta tag is used to tell browsers not to store cached link for the page. A “nofollow” attribute instruct search engines that a hyperlink should not influence the link target’s ranking in search engine. The “noindex” prevents page from being indexed.

HTML Metadata.question: The value of the ___________ attribute refers to the time interval in seconds before the refresh is performed.
HTML Metadata.explanation: The information/value of the content is provided by http-equiv through http header. Some values associated with http-equiv and name attribute are given by the content attribute. A scheme that to be used to interpret the value of the content is specified by the scheme tag. The name attribute specifies the name of input element and thus provides information/value of it.

HTML Microdata.question: __________ is an HTML specification used to add more information to HTML tags.
HTML Microdata.explanation: The Microdata spec provides a standardized syntax for additional semantic markup to your web pages to enhance the machine readability of your web pages. The planning for distribution center operation is offered by minidata. Macrodata and Modifydata are not any terms related to HTML5.

HTML Microdata.question: The microdata model consists of groups of name-value pairs known as ________
HTML Microdata.explanation: The microdata model consists of groups of name-value pairs known as items. Each group is known as an item. Each item can have item types, a global identifier (if the vocabulary specified by the item types support global identifiers for items), and a list of name-value pairs. A Uniform Resource Locator, called URL, termed as web address and is used for a reference to a web resource for finding its location. Property is information about a particular id or else attribute.

HTML Microdata.question: Every HTML element may have an ____________ attribute specified.
HTML Microdata.explanation: “itemtype” attribute specifies URL that is used to provide item’s data in data structure. An element with the itemscope attribute specified creates a new item, a group of name-value pairs.

HTML Microdata.question: Which of the following is true if the property value of a name-value pair added by an element with an itemprop attribute is a meta element?
options: The value is the item created by the element
The value is the value of the element’s value attribute, if it has one, or the empty string otherwise
On getting, if the element has a datetime content attribute, the IDL attribute must return that content attribute’s value
The value is the element’s textContent
HTML Microdata.explanation: When the property value of a name-value pair added by an element with an itemprop attribute which is a meta element then the value is the value of the element’s value attribute, if it has one, or the empty string otherwise. The “itemprop” attribute is a global attribute which adds properties to item.

HTML Microdata.question: Which of the following is true if the property value of a name-value pair added by an element with an itemprop attribute is a time element?
options: The value is the element’s datetime value
The value is the value of the element’s content attribute, if any, or the empty string if there is no such attribute
The value is the value of the element’s value attribute, if it has one, or the empty string otherwise
The value is the element’s textContent
HTML Microdata.explanation: The “itemprop” attribute is a global attribute which adds properties to item. When the property value of a name-value pair added by an element with an itemprop attribute which is a time element then the value is the element’s datetime value.

HTML Microdata.question: The ___________ of an item is the value of its element’s itemid attribute.
HTML Microdata.explanation: The global identifier of an item is the value of its element’s itemid attribute, if it has one, resolved relative to the element on which the attribute is specified. If the itemid attribute is missing or if resolving it fails, it is said to have no global identifier. The “typed item” creates new item.

HTML Microdata.question: If the element has an itemscope attribute, it returns an __________ object with all the element’s properties.
HTML Microdata.explanation: When an HTML document is loaded into a web browser, it becomes a document object. In web browser, document model represents document as a logical tree. The “itemscope” attribute which is of boolean type is used to state the scope of metadata.

HTML Microdata.question: Which of the following is true if the property value of a name-value pair added by an element with an itemprop attribute is a data element?
options: The value is the value of the element’s value attribute if it has one, or the empty string otherwise
The value is the item created by the element
The value is the element’s datetime value
HTML Microdata.explanation: The “itemprop” attribute is a global attribute which adds properties to item. When the property value of a name-value pair added by an element with an itemprop attribute which is a data element then the value is the value of the element’s value attribute if it has one, or the empty string otherwise.

HTML Microdata.question: Which method takes a string that contains an unordered set of unique space-separated tokens that are case-sensitive, representing types?
HTML Microdata.explanation: When called, the method must return a live NodeList object containing all the elements in the document, in tree order, that are each top-level microdata items whose types include all the types specified in the method’s argument, having obtained the types by splitting the string on spaces.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: Which of the following applications/software can be used to create a favicon?
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation: Favicon means favorite icon. To create a favicon, we can use any graphics editor program in the market such as Adobe Photoshop or Fireworks.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: By default, iOS adds ____________ effects to icons.
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation: Most of these icons are beautifully designed, and after Apple introduced a new meta tag named apple-touch-icon you can now display website icons on the iOS home screen when you bookmark a site. By default, IOS adds rounded corners with reflective shine.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: Favicon stands for ______
options: Both Fave icon and Favorite icon
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation: A favicon which is also known as a shortcut icon, Web site icon, tab icon, Fave icon and also a Favorite icon. It is associated with a particular website or a web page. Favicon is a graphical representation for a site.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: Which attribute is used for favicon?
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation:
Favicon is associated with a particular website or a web page. Favicon is a graphical representation for a site. The “rel” attribute is used for favicon generation. The syntax is

 <link rel="shortcut icon" type="image/x-icon" href="favicon.ico" />

.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: Which image file format is not supported in Firefox?
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation: There are different file formats such as MNG stands for “Multipe-image Network Graphics”, PNG stands for “Portable Network Graphics”, SVG stands for “Scalable Vector Graphics”, APNG stands for “Animated Portable Network Graphics” etc. Many browsers have theri own criteria to support those types of files. Among those, Firefox browser suuport PNG, APNG files, it also supports SVG partially. The MNG file format is not supported in Firefox.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: The favicon was standardized by the _______
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation: In december 1999, the favicon was standardized by W3C i.e World Wide Web Consortium. IANA is Internet Assigned Numbers Authority. WIPO stands for World Intellectual Property Organization and EPO for European Patent Office.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: In 2003, the .ico format was registered with the ____________
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation: In 2003, the .ico format was registered with the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) under the MIME type image/vnd.microsoft.icon. W3C is World Wide Consortium which standardized facicon for HTML 4.01 recommendation. WIPO stands for World Intellectual Property Organization and EPO for European Patent Office.

HTML Favicons and Icons.question: The recommended basic size for a favicon is ___________ pixels.
HTML Favicons and Icons.explanation: Facicon is a graphical representation of a site which stands for favorite icon. The basic size for a favicon varies from 16×16 pixels, 32×32 pixels, 48×48 pixels etc in ICO image file format.

Major Themes of (X)HTML.question: __________ is the XML equivalent to strict HTML 4.01.
Major Themes of (X)HTML.explanation: XML is a markup language while XHTML is a extensible hypertext markup language. XHTML 1.0 Strict is the XML equivalent to strict HTML 4.01, and includes elements and attributes that have not been marked deprecated in the HTML 4.01 specification.

Major Themes of (X)HTML.question: Which of the following statement is true?
options: Attribute names must be in uppercase
Attribute values should not be quoted
Major Themes of (X)HTML.explanation: HTML is hypertext markup language. There are many rules and regulations in HTML for attribute specification. HTML is case in-sensitive and thus we can write attribute name in either uppercase or lowercase, none of it is going to make difference. There is nothing like that atrribute name should be minimized, we can write attribute name as long as and as short as we want. The only rule for attribute name is that it should be in quoted form.

Major Themes of (X)HTML.question: The root element of an XHTML document must be html, and must contain an __________ attribute to associate it with the XHTML namespace.
Major Themes of (X)HTML.explanation: The xmlns attribute specifies the xml namespace for a document. It is manadatory in XHTML while in HTML5 it is optional. The root element of an XHTML document must be html, and must contain an xmlns atrribute to associate it with the XHTML namespace.

Major Themes of (X)HTML.question: Which of the following encoding an XML parser assumes?
Major Themes of (X)HTML.explanation: Basically parsers are used in softwares and they convert user data into machine data in short in memory form to use. In XML, parser is used to read XML. If an XML document lacks encoding specification, an XML parser assumes that the encoding is UTF-8 or UTF-16.

Major Themes of (X)HTML.question: __________ is an extended version of the XHTML markup language for supporting RDF through a collection of attributes and processing rules in the form of well-formed XML documents.
Major Themes of (X)HTML.explanation: XHTML+RDFa (Extensible Hypertext Markup Language + Resource Description Framework in attributes) is an extended version of the XHTML markup language for supporting RDF through a collection of attributes and processing rules in the form of well-formed XML documents.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: Which feature was already introduced before HTML5?
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: Until recently you could not draw on the web and graphics were not very interactive but canvas/SVG which were introduced by HTML5 solved all the problems. Video, Geolocation were also new features introduced by HTML5. Frames were already there before the launch of HTML5.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: Which tag is used with JavaScript?
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: <canvas> tag is basically used for graphics via scripting i.e. usually with Java Script (scripting language, basically used to create animations). Other tags like <table>, <article>, <footer> can be used simply with HTML.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: What application can one create even before the introduction of HTML5?
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: With the help of HTML5 and JavaScript it became possible to create excellent mobile applications, browser based games, web applications and many more other applications. Forms were already introduced before HTML5.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: What is the correct syntax of doctype in HTML5?
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: The correct syntax of HTML5 doctype is <!doctype html>, doctype is the very first thing to write in HTML5. <!doctype html> or <!DOCTYPE HTML> both are same because ‘doctype’ keyword is not case sensitive.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: What if one does not use the doctype in the starting of HTML document?
options: Browser finds the document in quirky mode
Browser finds a document in standard mode
Browser crashes after showing the page
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: If the browser finds <!doctype html> in the starting of an HTML document it sets the document in standard mode but if one does not use a doctype, the browser goes to quirky mode. In this mode, certain content will not be displayed as per one wrote that. So it is always recommended to write a doctype at the very start of the HTML document.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: Which of the following is not semantic element for text in HTML5?
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: Semantic elements used for text are <mark>, <time>, <wbr> whereas <article>, <aside>, <figure>, <footer>, <header> etc. are the semantic elements for structuring a page in HTML5.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: Which tag supports Non-English language?
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: <bdo>, <rp>, <rt>, <ruby> are some tags which support Non-English language. <input> is for web forms and <audio>, <embed> are the tags for audio and plug-ins.

HTML5 Basics – 1.question: Which element was not removed by HTML5?
HTML5 Basics – 1.explanation: Although HTML5 adds new elements, it also kicked out some old elements like <big>, <center>, <font>, <tt>, <strike>. HTML5 adapted many elements also <small> is one among these. The <small> element represents “small print”.

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: Which of the following defines the title of a work?
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation: The <cite> tag defines the title of a work. The <hr> tag is used to give a horizontal break. When we want to link one page to another, then <a> tag is used. The <address> tag is used to define the contact information about owner of document.

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: Which element is design to wrap a single piece of information?
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation: <time> tag wrap single piece of information i.e. it defines date, month and year. The <nav> element identifies a set of navigation links, <footer> is introduced in HTML5 which is present at the end of page and do conatins footer information i.e copyright information.

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: What an article element should not contain?
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation: The <main> element must NOT be a descendant of an <article>, <aside>, <footer>, <header>, or <nav> element. The article element may contain audio/video clips, images and also text or embedded content.

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: Which of the following statement is true?
options: SVG needs scripts to draw elements
In canvas, drawing is done with pixels
SVG don’t support to event handlers
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation: In SVG drawing is done with vectors and it support event handlers. Canvas doesn’t contains any built-in-animations and drawing is done with pixels.

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: What does <main> include?
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation: <header> element contains navigation links. Slidebar is for hoverable/sliding text. <footer> is introduced in HTML5 which is present at the end of page and do contains footer information i.e copyright information. Main content is the entire article which wraps the <article> element. It holds the page’s main content. It can be useful for screen readers. E.g. <main> <article>…………</article> </main>

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: Which of the following is not sectioning elements?
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation: The <section> element represents a section of a document or application. Tags like <article>, <aside>, <nav>, <section> are the ones that create a nested, new outline inside the page.

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: How many times can HTML5 events be fired?
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation: We can call events like drag, ondragover, etc multiple times in HTML5.

HTML5 Basics – 2.question: Which element is used to get highlighted text in HTML5?
HTML5 Basics – 2.explanation:
The element is used to highlight a section of text. It is useful for quoting a text or if one wants to bring attention to the text. The tag is used to make text/paragraph bold. tag is used to underline the text you wanted.

This is the example. I like this dog.

Output: This is the example. I like this dog.

HTTP Overview.question: In OSI model USB lies under the layer ___________
HTTP Overview.explanation: There are seven layers namely Physical layer, data Link layer, network Layer, transport layer, session layer, presentation layer, and application layer. The physical layer is the first layer, it is used for transmitting electrical signal across the network. Examples are USB, Bluetooth or Ethernet.

HTTP Overview.question: IP is used in the level ___________
HTTP Overview.explanation: Network layer is the third layer, it deals with routing across complicated networks, Internet Protocol (IP) is very commonly used at this level. It is capable of traveling across multiple networks. It can also travel through intermediate devices like routers.

HTTP Overview.question: Which one is not the feature of HTTP protocol?
HTTP Overview.explanation: There are basically three main features of HTTP protocol i.e HTTP is media independent, HTTP is connectionless and it is stateless also. Browser initiates HTTP request, and then client disconnects from the server.

HTTP Overview.question: Which of the following are not the valid character set in HTTP?
HTTP Overview.explanation: A character set must know to web browsers to display HTML pages correctly. For the preference of clients we use character sets for specifying characters. The default value is US-ASCII. The valid character sets are ISO-8859-1, US-ASCII or ISO-8859-7.

HTTP Overview.question: Which one is the correct syntax for specifying media type?
HTTP Overview.explanation: Internet media types are used in Content-Type and Accept header fields. Media types are registered with IANA (Internet Assigned Number Authority). The syntax for a media type is m-type = type “/” subtype *(“;” parameter). The name of subtype, type and parameter attribute all are case sensitive.

HTTP Overview.question: Which header field defines meta information?
HTTP Overview.explanation: A HTTP header which does not relate to the content of message is a response-header. A request-header is used to provide information about request or response. Entity-header field defines meta information about the body. If the body is not present resource is identified by request. The general syntax for all the header fields is msg-header=field-name “:” [field-value]. General-header field is for both response and request.

HTTP Overview.question: Which of the following is not the request method?
HTTP Overview.explanation: There are various request methods on the resource identified by Request-URI. Get, post, head, delete, trace, connect, put and options are some of the methods. For retrieving information from the server we use Get method.

HTTP Overview.question: Which symbol is used when HTTP request does not apply to the particular source?
HTTP Overview.explanation: When HTTP request does not apply to particular resource ‘*’ is used. It is applied to the server itself. This is only allowed when the used method is not necessarily applied to the resource. E.g. OPTIONS * HTTP/1.1

HTTP Overview.question: Which of the following is not a request-header field?
HTTP Overview.explanation: For passing additional information about request we use request-header fields. These are also requested modifiers. There are several request-header fields like Accept-Encoding, Expect, Accept-Charset, Accept-Language, Form, Host, Authorization, If-Match, Proxy-Authorization, Range, User-Agent, TE, Referer, If-Unmodified-Since, If-Range.

HTTP Overview.question: What does ‘3xx’ code denote?
HTTP Overview.explanation: ‘3xx’ means Redirection, any further action have to be taken for completing the request. ‘1xx’ is for Informational, it signifies that the request was received and the process is going on. ‘2xx’ denotes Success, which signifies the action was successfully understood, received and accepted.

HTTP Overview.question: Which of the following is not a response-header field?
HTTP Overview.explanation: For passing additional information about the response that can’t be placed in Status-Line, we use response-header fields. Some of the fields are Age, Accept-Ranges, Location, ETag, WWW-Authenticate, Vary, Server, Retry-After.

Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.topic: Embracing the Reality of Web Markup
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.question: Which of the following HTML 4 attributes is not removed in HTML5?
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.explanation: Mark attribute is still used in HTML5 but rest of attributes i.e. text, rules, link are deprecated in HTML5.

Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.topic: Embracing the Reality of Web Markup
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.question: Which of the following element is not removed by HTML5?
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.explanation: A <span> element (used to color a part of a text) is still used in HTML5. Elements like vlink, marginwidth and compact has been removed in HTML5, which were part of HTML markup. In earlier they have been deprecated.

Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.topic: Embracing the Reality of Web Markup
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.question: Which of the following is not a newly added element in HTML5?
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.explanation: An article tag is semantic element newly introduced in HTML5 along with nav and audio. Frameset was already introduced in HTML markup used to divide window/web page in frames.

Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.topic: Embracing the Reality of Web Markup
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.question: ____________ defines the accelerator key to be used for keyboard access to an element.
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.explanation: Command tag specifies a command provided with action. When one want to provide parentheses around ruby text, rp tag is used. The accesskey attribute specifies a shortcut key to activate/focus an element. Data-X stores data.

Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.topic: Embracing the Reality of Web Markup
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.question: Which of the following element represents the header of a section or the document and contains a label or other heading information for the related content?
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.explanation: Data-X element consist of data. The mark element indicates highlighted/marked text. The header element represents a container for introductory content or a set of navigational links.

Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.topic: Embracing the Reality of Web Markup
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.question: Which of the following element sets is an item of metadata?
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.explanation: Itemscope is a boolean global attribute that defines the scope of associated metadata. The itemscope attribute creates a new item, a group of name-value pairs. The URL of vocabulary is specified by itemtype global attribute. List of element ID’s is provided by itemref.

Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.topic: Embracing the Reality of Web Markup
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.question: _____________ defines a group of content that should be used as a figure and may be labeled by a legend element.
Embracing the Reality of Web Markup.explanation: The aside tag contains data related to its surrounding. <output> is result of anything. The figure tag specifies self-contained content, like illustrations, diagrams, photos, code listings, etc. Additional details that someone wants to know or hide as per demand are provided by details element.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: Which element is used to define a discrete unit of content such as a blogpost, comment, and so on?
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation: Sections in document is made by the section tag. The class attribute specifies one or more class names to HTML. An article element is semantic element and it contains a standalone piece of content that would make sense if syndicated as an RSS item, for example a news item.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: HTML5 documents may contains a ___________ element, which is used to set the header section of a document.
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation: Section element is used to make sections in document. The copyright/footer information is provided by footer element in HTML5. A header for document section is given by header element. The header tag is used to contain the header content of a site.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: Which element may be used within content to represent material that is tangential?
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation: <cite> tag defines the title of work. The class attribute specifies one or more class names to HTML. An article tag is similar to <section> or <header> which contains information. The aside tag defines a block of content that is related to the main content around it, but not central to the flow of it.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: ____________ contains the navigation menu, or other navigation functionality for the page.
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation: The nav element is for marking up the navigation links or other constructs (eg a search form) that will take you to different pages of the current site, or different areas of the current page. Header contains section of headings. Section element is used to make sections in document. The aside tag defines a block of content that is related to the main content around it, but not central to the flow of it.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: Which of the following attribute is used to display date/time content?
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation: To provide both human and machine-friendly date/time content, the element supports a datetime attribute, which should be set to the previously mentioned date format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD. Time tag defines date and time (human readable) while datetime tag display machine readable date/time.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: The element ___________ simply groups items within an enclosed dd tag, though it may associate them with a caption defined by a dt tag.
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation: HTML documents are delivered as “documents”.These are then parsed, which turns them into the Document Object Model (DOM) internal representation, within the web browser. A self-contained information like images, diagrams are specified by figure tag in HTML. External applications are embed using embed tag.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: Which of the following element is used for highlighting content similarly to how a highlighter pen might be used on important text in a book?
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation: <em> tag convert the font in italic one. The <strong> tag is used to denote the importance of text. <bold> tag is used to make the text bold in font size. The mark tag defines marked text and is used to highlight parts of your text.

HTML5 Document Structure.question: Which tag is used to encapsulate navigation and then style the elements appropriately as menu items?
HTML5 Document Structure.explanation:
Conventionally, many web developers have use
    and
  • tags to encapsulate navigation and then styled the elements appropriately as menu items. This seems to introduce quite a bit of ambiguity in markup because it may be difficult to determine the difference between a list that has links in it and a list that is simply navigation.

HTML5 Open Media Effort.question: __________ can be used to advise the browser to download media content in the background to improve playback.
HTML5 Open Media Effort.explanation: Data-X stores custom data. Buffer property is used to decide whether the output should be buffered or not. If autobuffering attribute is used, then the video will automatically begin to buffer even if it’s not set. It suggests to the browser that it should load as much of the resource as possible. As long as the browser’s own media cache isn’t full, it will keep on downloading. URL of an image is given by poster attribute until the user seek for it.

HTML5 Open Media Effort.question: The _________ element is used to render simple graphics such as line art, graphs, and other custom graphical elements on the client side.
HTML5 Open Media Effort.explanation: Metdata gives data or information of other data. CSS i.e. Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language. Canvas is introduced in HTML5 for providing/drawing graphics. The canvas element is part of HTML5 and allows for dynamic, scriptable rendering of 2D shapes and bitmap images.

HTML5 Open Media Effort.question: Which plugins can provide the fallback support for old browsers?
HTML5 Open Media Effort.explanation: An attribute of the format: type=”application/x-shockwave-flash” will justify the purpose.

HTML5 Open Media Effort.question: Which of the following is not the promises of the open web platform?
HTML5 Open Media Effort.explanation:
The different promises of the open web platform are –
• Security and Privacy
• Core Web Design and Development
• Device Interaction
• Application Lifecycle
• Media and Real-Time Communications
• Performance and Tuning
• Usability and Accessibility
• Services

HTML5 Video.question: Which protocol is supported by Android browsers?
HTML5 Video.explanation: HTTPS i.e. Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure is used on internet. HLS which stands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol Live Streaming invented by Apple Inc., a new streaming protocol which is supported by android browsers. RTMP stands for Real-Time Messaging Protocol, FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol.

HTML5 Video.question: __________ is a JavaScript library that implements the most common user interface elements and interactions like sliders, accordions, tabs, and so on.
HTML5 Video.explanation: JQuery UI is a curated set of user interface interactions, effects, widgets, and themes built on top of the jQuery JavaScript Library. JavaScript is a scripting language. VTS is a powerful rendering engine browser for JavaScript. JCL is Job Control Language which is also named as scripting language.

HTML5 Video.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM, __________ sets or returns whether the audio/video should be loaded when the page loads.
HTML5 Video.explanation: Autoplay, preload, buffered, controller etc are the different kinds of attribute of video/audio element. Using autoplay, video/audio automatically begins to play. The preload property allows the author to provide a hint to the browser about what he/she thinks will lead to the best user experience. This attribute may be ignored in some instances.

HTML5 Video.question: What will happen if height and width of video are not set while video loads?
HTML5 Video.explanation: If height and width are not set, the browser does not know the size of the video. The effect will be that the page will change (or flicker) while the video loads.

HTML5 Video.question: Which of the following HTML Video – Media Type is supported in IE?
HTML5 Video.explanation: The most widely used format for HTML video i.e MP4 format is supported in IE. The other formats such as WebM, Ogg and MP4 FLAC are not supported in IE.

HTML5 Video.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM, __________ sets or returns the default speed of the audio/video playback.
HTML5 Video.explanation: CurrentTime set or returns current playback position while playing audio/video. The length of the current audio/video is set or returned by duration. Default speed of playback is given by defaultPlaybackRate while playback returns speed of the audio/video.

HTML5 Video.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM, __________ sets or returns the CORS settings of the audio/video.
HTML5 Video.explanation: CurrentTime set or returns current playback position while playing audio/video. The length of the current audio/video is set or returned by duration. Default speed of playback is given by defaultPlaybackRate. The purpose of the crossorigin attribute is to allow you to configure the CORS requests for the element’s fetched data.

HTML5 Video.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM, __________ returns a TimeRanges object representing the buffered parts of the audio/video.
HTML5 Video.explanation: Preload is used to set or return whether the video/ audio has been loaded on page. Current network of audio/video has been set or returned by networkState. A buffered range is a time-range of buffered audio/video. The user gets several buffered ranges if he/she skips in the audio/video. Media controller of current video/audio is given or returned by controller.

HTML5 Audio.question: Which of the following browser does not support wav file format?
HTML5 Audio.explanation: Opera, firefox, chrome and internet explorer are different kinds of browsers. Out of which audio file format named wav is not supported by internet explorer.

HTML5 Audio.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM __________ sets or returns the volume of the audio/video.
HTML5 Audio.explanation: Src attribute gives current source of audio/video element. The videoTrack list is returned representing available video tracks by video track attribute. Volume attribute sets the current volume of video/audio.

HTML5 Audio.question: Which of the following attribute adds audio controls, like play, pause, and volume?
HTML5 Audio.explanation: The audio attribute defines sound, such as music or other audio streams. Source attribute defines multiple media resources for media elements, such as <video> and <audio>. Src attribute gives current source of audio/video element. The controls attribute is a boolean attribute. When present, it specifies that audio controls should be displayed.

HTML5 Audio.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM __________ sets or returns whether the audio/video should start playing as soon as it is loaded.
HTML5 Audio.explanation: Control attribute is used to set whether audio/video should display controls. AudioTrack list representing audio tracks is set by audio track. The autoplay attribute is a boolean attribute. When present, the audio will automatically start playing as soon as it can do so without stopping. A current src of audio/video is returned by currentSrc.

HTML5 Audio.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM __________ sets or returns whether the audio/video should start over again when finished.
HTML5 Audio.explanation: The loop attribute is a boolean attribute. When present, it specifies that the audio will start over again, every time it is finished. With autoplay, it ensures whether video/audio should play immediately after loading page. Seeking returns whether user is currently seeking video/audio. Timeranges representing played parts of audio/video is set by played attribute.

HTML5 Audio.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM __________ returns a MediaError object representing the error state of the audio/video.
HTML5 Audio.explanation: Seeking returns whether user is currently seeking video/audio. Ended attribute fires up when current playing playlist is finished. The error property returns a MediaError object. The MediaError object has a code property containing the error state of the audio/video. The group to which audio/video belongs is returned by mediaGroup.

HTML5 Audio.question: In HTML Audio/Video DOM __________ returns a TextTrackList object representing the available text tracks.
HTML5 Audio.explanation: The current ready state of video/audio is set by readyState. StartDate sets current date representing current time offsets. VideoTrack returns video track list representing available video tracks. The textTracks property returns a TextTrackList object. The TextTrackList object represents the available text tracks for the audio/video. Each available text track is represented by an TextTrack Object.

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: Which of the following statement is not true?
options: SVG stands for Scalable Vector Graphics
SVG is used to define graphics for the Web
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: SVG stands for “Scalable Vector Graphics”, it is used to draw graphics for the web. W3C recommends SVG graphics. SVG also supports event handlers which is not supported in canvas.

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: To draw on the canvas, authors must first obtain a reference to a context using the ______________ method of the canvas interface element.
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: The method getImageData(), returns an imageData that copies pixel data for a specified thing in canvas. ContextType is a DOMString containing the context identifier defining the drawing context associated to the canvas.

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: The ___________ method must add the scaling transformation described by the arguments to the transformation matrix.
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: HTML5 canvas provides scale(x, y) method which is used to increase or decrease the units in our canvas grid. The position (0, 0) is remaped in canvas by translate(x, y) method. If one want to rotate the current drawing then rotate(angle) method can be used.

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: Which method must clear the pixels in the specified rectangle that also intersects the current clipping region to a fully transparent black, erasing any previous image?
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: StrokeRect(x, y, w, h) draws rectangle without filling it. The clearRect() method clears the specified pixels within a given rectangle. FillRect(x, y, w, h) method draws filled rectangle.

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: When the _____________ method is passed an animated image as its image argument, the user agent must use the poster frame of the animation, or, if there is no poster frame, the first frame of the animation.
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: The width of specified text present in an object is given by measureText() method. The drawImage() method draws an image, canvas, or video onto the canvas. ImageData() method provides image data in pixels in canvas.

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: The ____________ method must create a new clipping region by calculating the intersection of the current clipping region and the area described by the current path, using the non-zero winding number rule.
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: The path one defines is drawn by stroke() method. Any region/shape or size in canvas is clipped by clip(). The fill() method fills the current drawing (path). The default color is black. There is no method like get().

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: The ____________ method must fill all the subpaths of the current path, using fillStyle, and using the non-zero winding number rule.
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: The path one defines is drawn by stroke() method. Any region/shape or size in canvas is clipped by clip(). The fill() method fills the current drawing (path). The default color is black. There is no method like get().

HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.question: Which of the following methods must empty the list of subpaths so that the context once again has zero subpaths?
HTML5 Client-Side Graphics with Canvas.explanation: ClosePath() creates a path that starts from current point up to the starting point. The beginPath() method begins a path, or resets the current path. MoveTo(x, y) moves the point specified in canvas but without creating the line. There is nothing like endPath() in canvas.

HTML5 Form Changes.question: Which of the following is not a type of attribute for input tag?
HTML5 Form Changes.explanation: Day is not defined in the pre-defined attribute list of input tag. Week attribute defines week and year when used as attribute in input tag. Month specifies month and year when it is accessed in input tag. The time attribute displays current time in html.

HTML5 Form Changes.question: The new __________ element is supposed to represent some form of extra details, such as a tooltip or revealed region that may be shown to a user.
HTML5 Form Changes.explanation: A scalar measurement within a range or fractional value is defined by meter tag. A list/menu of coommands is displayed by menu tag in html. The details tag specifies additional details that the user can view or hide on demand. The details tag can be used to create an interactive widget that the user can open and close. Any sort of content can be put inside the <details> tag. Progress of a task is done by progress element.

HTML5 Form Changes.question: The __________ element may contain not just links but also other interactive items, including the newly introduced command element.
HTML5 Form Changes.explanation: A scalar measurement within a range or fractional value is defined by meter tag. The menu tag defines a list/menu of commands. The menu tag is used for context menus, toolbars and for listing form controls and commands. The details tag specifies additional details that the user can view or hide on demand. The details tag can be used to create an interactive widget that the user can open and close. Any sort of content can be put inside the <details> tag. Progress of a task is done by progress element.

HTML5 Form Changes.question: The __________ attribute effectively renders the iframe as an inline include, which allows the parent document’s CSS to affect the contents of the iframe.
HTML5 Form Changes.explanation: Embed attribute attach external content at a specified point in document. The seamless attribute is a boolean attribute. When present, it specifies that the iframe should look like it is a part of the containing document (no borders or scrollbars). Allow-forms re-enables from submission. Scripts are re-enabled by allow-scripts.

HTML5 Form Changes.question: Which of the following allows the sandboxed iframe to run scripts from the same domain?
HTML5 Form Changes.explanation: Scripts are re-enabled by allow-scripts. The sandbox attribute enables an extra set of restrictions for the content in the iframe. Allow-forms re-enables from submission. Allow-same-origin allows iframe content to be treated as being from the same origin. API’s are re-enable by allow-pointer-lock.

HTML5 Form Changes.question: __________ allows the iframe to pull in content from elsewhere in the same domain.
HTML5 Form Changes.explanation: Scripts are re-enabled by allow-scripts. Allow-forms re-enables from submission. Allow-same-origin allows iframe content to be treated as being from the same origin. API’s are re-enable by allow-pointer-lock.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: What does ‘On-Screen Action’ means in the testing of HTML5 applications?
options: Using play and pause action of audio and video elements
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: While testing of HTML5 for a browser i.e. whether its elements are supported by the browser or not one can use draggable content using Drag action and this action can be called through On-Screen Action operation.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: What can be used to verify a displayed graphics?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: Region checkpoints are used to verify a displayed graphics. It is a kind of test operation which gives verification of application’s window or control is displayed correctly or not. Object’s property is verified by region checkpoints which is test operation. Local storage is for storing data.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which element has been removed from HTML5 (W3C) specification?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: A section that is tangentially related to its surrounding content is defined by <aside> tag. A block of navigation links is provided by newly added element in HTML5 called <nav>. <hgroup> tag has been removed from HTML5 specification, but it can be seen in WHATWG version of HTML. The purpose of this element is how headings are displayed. It’s practice is limited to theory only. <figure> tag specifies its own self defined content which may contain diagrams, photos etc.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which of the following is used for plug-in content?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: <embed> tag is new in HTML5 which also helps in validation of HTML5 page. It has attributes like height, src, type and width. HTML4 does not support this tag. Multiple media sources for video , audio and pictures are provided by <source> tag. <meter> tag gives a scalar measurement within a particular range. Progress of a task is shown by <progress> element.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which of the following does not lie under the attribute of <input> and is not supported by Opera?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: <input> element type has new values as ‘url’, ‘email’, ‘datetime’, ‘date’, ‘month’, ‘tel’, ‘time’, ‘number’, ‘search’, ‘color’, ‘range’, ‘datetime-local’, ‘week’.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which is the new attribute of <input> element that is used to change the appearance of checkbox?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: The indeterminate is actually not an attribute, it is the property of checkbox which can be change via JavaScript, e.g. Var checkbox=document.getElementById(“any-checkbox”); Checkbox.indeterminate=true;

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which attribute does not lie inside <a> and <area> elements?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: Preload is the attribute of the <video> element. Media, ping, hreflang, rel are the attribute used with <a> and <area> elements.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which element does not support autofocus attribute?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: Autofocus is a new attribute as well as very interesting one. It can be specified on <input>, <textarea>, <button> and <select> elements. It is a way to focus a form control when the page is loaded.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which element does not support form attribute?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: The new form attribute is for <input>, <select>, <textarea>, <button>, <output> and <fieldset>. One can place these elements anywhere on the page.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which attribute of <input> element can be used both with <datalist> and <select> elements?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: List is the new attribute of <input> element and can be used together with <datalist> and <select> elements. Other attributes like pattern, multiple, max, min, step are new attribute used with the <input> element only.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which is not a Boolean attribute?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: Formtarget attribute is a Boolean attribute that must have a value that is a valid browsing context name. Multiple is a new Boolean attribute of <input> the element which specifies constraint, novalidate, and formvalidate are <form> attribute and are Boolean as well.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which of the following is not the keyword of form method attribute?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: The keyword GET, POST, PUT, DELETE mapped to the state GET, POST, PUT, DELETE and indicating the HTTP method respectively.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: What is the work of async attribute?
options: It gives a label to the menu
Enables a set of extra restrictions on any content
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: Async is the new attribute of the <script> element which influences script loading and its execution. It is a Boolean attribute which shows the manner of script execution. If async is present, the script will be executed asynchronously, as soon as it is available.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which is not <iframe> attribute?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: Sizes is the attribute of <link> element. Sandbox is the attribute of <iframe> element that enables a set of extra restrictions on any content, seamless is a Boolean attribute of <iframe> which seamlessly included in the parent document, srcdoc attribute gives the content of the page that the nested browsing context is to contain.

HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.question: Which is not a new global attribute in HTML5?
HTML5 Applicationn Elements & Attributes.explanation: Contenteditable, contextmenu, data, draggable, hidden, role, aria, spellcheck all are new global attributes introduced in HTML5. Class, dir, id, lang, style, tabindex, title are the attributes of HTML4 and now specified as global in HTML5.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: How do we write comments in HTML5?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: Browser ignores comment in a code. There are always two types of command i.e. single line command and multiple line command. If one wants to add a comment in code, add the text between these characters <!…..comment….>. It will not visible in the user’s browser.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: Which one is correct syntax?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: is the correct syntax for id type declaration. Id attribute’s value should start with a letter or an underscore. We cannot use any number or other character for defining name of the id.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: Which of the following is not example of block element?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation:
The elements which always appear to start on a new line in browser are known as block level elements. Examples are

,
    ,
  • and

    .

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: What does semantic markup not define?
options: where an emphasis is placed in a sentence
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: < Semantic markup> which provides extra information, such as where emphasis is placed in a sentence, that something you have written is a quotation, the meaning of acronyms etc.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: How many levels of headings HTML has?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: HTML has six “levels ” of headings.<h1> is used for main headings,<h2> is used for subheadings. There is no other levels other than <h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <h5>, <h6>

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: What is the size of content of an <h1> element?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: The contents of an <h1> element is the largest and the contents of an <h6> element is the smallest. Rest of <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <h5> lies in between largest and smallest.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: What is the tag used for making character appearance bold?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation:
By enclosing words in the tags and we can make characters appear bold. element is for content in italics, is for underlined content,
is for vertical breaking.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: For writing chemical formula of water which tag will be used?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation:
The element is used to contain characters that should be subscript. It is commonly used with foot notes or chemical formulas. E.g. H20, is use for superscript,
is for horizontal break,
    is for unordered list.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: which tag will be used For raising number to a power?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation:
The element is used to contain characters that should be superscript. It is commonly used with foot notes or chemical formulae. E.g. X2 ,
is for break,
    is for unordered list.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: What is the use of <hr/> tag?
options: To create horizontal rule between sections
To create vertical rule between sections
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: To create a break between themes-such as change of topic in a book or a new scene in a play-you can add a horizontal rule between sections using <hr/> tag

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: Which of the following is not an empty element.
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: There are a few elements that do not have any words between an opening and closing tag. They are known as empty elements. An empty element usually has only one tag. Before the closing angled bracket of an empty element, there will often be a space and a forward slash.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: Which attribute is not essential under <iframe>?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: An iframe is equivalent to a window that has been cut into our page, it is created using <iframe> element. Src, height, width attribute are essentially used inside of this. Src attribute specifies the URL of the page which is to be shown. Height and width specify the height and width of an iframe in pixels.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: Which is not the attribute of <meta> element?
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: <meta> element contains information about web page. Description attribute contains the description of the web page, keywords contains the list of comma separated words, robots decide to add pages to search results.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: Copyright symbol can be included by _________
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: HTML code has some characters that are reserved so for using those on the page one need to know “escape” characters. If you want to add a copyright symbol to the web page they can use &copy or &#169.

HTML5 Beyond Markup.question: Attributes that allow to identify particular element are ____________
HTML5 Beyond Markup.explanation: The id and class attributes are useful in identifying particular elements. <iframe> element is for creating frames in web page, <div> and <span> are inline elements, metadata is provided by <meta> tag.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: All elements are identified by their __________ and are marked up using either start tags and end tags or self-closing tags.
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The attribute name describes name of <input> element. The tagName property returns the tag name of the element. In HTML, the returned value of the tagName property is always in UPPERCASE. Name of class is returned by class name.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: The __________ element represents a span of text that is isolated from its surroundings for the purposes of bidirectional text formatting.
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The base Url target relative to all URL’s in document is specified by base tag in html. B is for bold text representation. bdi stands for Bi-directional Isolation. This element is useful when embedding user-generated content with an unknown directionality. Direction of text is displayed by bdo element.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: The interactive element audio with the attribute controls must not appear as a descendant of which element?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The anchor and the button tag acts as link which cannot be a parent of audio element.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: A ____________ element must have a start tag but must not have an end tag.
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The command tag is new in HTML5 and specifies a normal command with an action. Details has end tag.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: Which type attribute of input element sets the element’s value to a string representing a number?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The input element with a type attribute whose value is “range” represents an imprecise control for setting the element’s value to a string representing a number.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: Which of the following type attributes of input element defines control for entering a telephone number?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The input element with a type attribute whose value is “tel” represents a one-line plain-text edit control for entering a telephone number.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: Which element represents a control for generating a public-private key pair?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The command tag is new in HTML5 and specifies a normal command with an action. The keygen element represents a control for generating a public-private key pair and for submitting the public key from that key pair.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: Which element represents marked or highlighted text for reference purposes?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: Highlight element is used to highlight a particular text when used in a document. Strong element specifies the importance of text. The mark element represents a run of text in one document marked or highlighted for reference purposes, due to its relevance in another context. An enclosed text which flashes later on is created by blink element.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: Which element(s) represents a section of a document that links to other documents?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The nav element represents a section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page: a section with navigation links.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: Which of the following element marks the ruby text component of a ruby annotation?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: A ruby annotation is specified by ruby text, which is small text attached to the main text, which is used to indicate the pronunciation of characters. The rt element is the markup for ruby text.

Major HTML5 Themes.question: Subtitle tracks and caption tracks to be specified for audio and video elements can be added using which of the following element?
Major HTML5 Themes.explanation: The track element enables supplementary media tracks such as subtitle tracks and caption tracks to be specified for audio and video elements.

HTML5 Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG).question: Which of the following is not the property of SVG images?
HTML5 Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG).explanation: SVG images stands for Scalable Vector Graphics which are scalable, zoomable and resolution independent. SVG is an open standard.

HTML5 Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG).question: _______ drawings can be dynamic and interactive.
HTML5 Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG).explanation: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is an XML-based vector image format for two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and animation.
